learning.title: Choosing the Right Channel and Medium

questions.promptMd: Which channel is most appropriate for delivering sensitive performance feedback?
questions.rationaleMd: Tests mapping of message sensitivity to channel richness.

answers.contentMd: Private video or voice call with a written summary afterward
answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Rich, synchronous communication allows nuance; a summary preserves clarity.
Public channels risk embarrassment and defensiveness.
Overly broad and inappropriate for sensitive topics.
Too impersonal and permanent for sensitive feedback.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Synchronous meetings are always better than asynchronous updates for complex topics.
questions.rationaleMd: Addresses nuance of sync vs. async tradeoffs.

answers.feedbackMd: Not always. Async pre‑reads + structured discussion often outperform pure sync.
Correct. Use async for info density and sync for alignment/decisions.

questions.promptMd: Which factor should NOT drive channel selection?

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Optimize for audience needs, sensitivity, and objective—not just convenience.
These should shape richness and synchronicity.
Crucial to maximize comprehension and response.

questions.promptMd: True or False: For simple FYIs, async email/post with a clear headline and tags is often preferable to a meeting.
questions.rationaleMd: Applies best practice for low‑stakes information sharing.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Save meetings for alignment and decisions; keep FYIs async.
Meetings for FYIs waste time and attention.
